title: Welcome to My Blog
author: Nadeem
excerpt: A short welcome message and what to expect on this blog.
content:
Welcome! This blog is a simple, responsive template built with HTML, CSS and JavaScript. Posts are stored in a local JSON file.

Write, publish, and share.

title: 5 Quick Responsive Design Tips
author: Nadeem
excerpt: Practical tips to make your websites responsive quickly.
content:
Tip 1 — Mobile-first

Design for the smallest screens first, then scale up.

Tip 2 — Fluid Grids

Use percentage-based widths instead of fixed units.

Tip 3 — Flexible Images

Ensure media scales with max-width:100%.

Tip 4 — Breakpoints

Pick breakpoints based on content, not devices.

Tip 5 — Test Often

Check your site on multiple devices.

title: HTML & CSS Best Practices for Beginners
author: Nadeem
excerpt: Simple habits to make your code clean, reusable, and professional.
content:
• Use semantic HTML tags (header, main, footer, article).
  • Keep CSS modular and avoid inline styles.
  • Comment sections of your code for readability.
  • Organize CSS with variables for colors, spacing, and typography.
  • Validate your HTML/CSS with tools like W3C validator.

title: JavaScript Basics Every Developer Should Know
author: Nadeem
excerpt: Understanding variables, functions, and DOM manipulation.
content:
1. Variables

Learn let, const, and var — and know when to use them.

2. Functions

Functions are reusable blocks of code that perform tasks.

3. DOM

Use document.querySelector to grab elements and update them dynamically.

4. Events

Attach click, input, or custom events to make pages interactive.

5. Arrays & Objects

They’re the core of working with data in JS.

title: Blogging Tips for Developers
author: Nadeem
excerpt: Want to start blogging about code and projects? Here are tips to help you.
content:
1. Write in simple language — make your posts easy to follow.

2. Add code snippets to explain concepts.

3. Use screenshots or diagrams for visual learners.

4. Share your learning journey, not just finished work.

5. Be consistent with posting schedule.

title: How This Blog Template Works
author: Nadeem
excerpt: Behind the scenes: posts are rendered dynamically from JSON using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
content:
This template is built with:

  • HTML for structure
  • CSS for responsive styling
  • JavaScript for loading JSON posts

Advantages:

  • No need for a heavy CMS like WordPress
  • Easy to customize
  • Lightweight and fast
